medical_history.chief_complaint: Nausea, vomiting, abdominal distension, and food intolerance.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 48 hours prior to presentation. The patient became increasingly uncomfortable, with tenderness in the left scrotum noted around the same time. There was a reported last normal bowel movement before the symptoms began. The mother noted he may have had a temperature prior to presentation.
